qas.question: What did he do when he thought he might be made Bishop?
Who did the Catholics of Alexandria want as their Bishop?
Was there someone else that was preferred as Bishop?
When did Alexander ask to see Athanasius?
What did he do when he thought he might be fired from being Bishop?
Who didn't the Catholics of Alexandria want as their Bishop?
When did Athanasius ask to see Alexander?

context: In the light of Mother F. A. Forbes research and reference to Pope Saint Gregory's writings, it would appear that Athanasius was constrained to be Bishop: She writes that when the Patriarch Alexander was <a3_0>on his <b6_0>death-bed<b6_0/><a3_0/> he called Athanasius, who <a0_0><b4_0>fled<b4_0/><a0_0/> fearing he would be constrained to be made Bishop. "When the Bishops of the Church assembled to elect their new Patriarch, the whole Catholic population surrounded the church, holding up their hands to Heaven and crying; <a1_0>"Give us <b5_0>Athanasius<b5_0/>!"<a1_0/> <a2_0>The Bishops had nothing better<a2_0/>. Athanasius was thus elected, as Gregory tells us..." (Pope Gregory I, would have full access to the Vatican Archives).
